group_1.textLeft: ...[wait:0.8][chara:104000:lipSynch_1]Thank...you.
Well, that was a piece a' cake.

group_1.textRight: Having the trust of other Magical Girls like that@is the power of a Coordinator...
Is that what you're trying to say...?

group_1.textLeft: I haven't said anythin' yet, but yep, more or less.

group_1.textRight: ...You're...pretty strong...

group_1.textLeft: Oh? What's this, all of a sudden?
This side a' you's real cute, though.

group_1.textRight: Shut up.

group_1.textLeft: You didn't call me a "coward" this time...so do you@see what your problem is?

group_1.textRight: One of my flaws is that...
I can't fight on my own.
But the bigger problem is...
I didn't know what it meant to "live strongly".
I guess I've gotta admit my weakness in order@to do that.
And yet, I hadn't accepted that 'til now.
Guess that's what you meant when you called me@"weak", huh.

group_1.textLeft: You got it.
To be more specific, it ain't bein' unable to fight@that makes ya weak.
It's the fact that ya don't have the power to live.
If ya can't make it in battle, ya gotta figure out@the best way for you to survive.
That's what it means to be strong.
Ain't no shame in followin' someone else.
First off, ya gotta understand yourself and grow@some self-control.

group_1.textCenter: There's so much you can't do compared to the@other children.
You've got to at least learn how to manage@your time properly.
You won't be able to go on living at this rate!!@Why can't you get that through your head?!

group_1.textRight: (This woman really is a lot like her...)
(Going and saying the same stuff as my mother@again...)
(The only thing that's a little different is that...@I'm listening so eagerly this time...)
(After all these years...)
(I never thought I'd finally realize the meaning@of my mother's words...)
...[wait:0.8][chara:104000:cheek_0][chara:104000:face_mtn_ex_010.exp.json][chara:104000:lipSynch_1]Heh...

group_1.textLeft: W-what?@I didn't say somethin' funny, did I?

group_1.textRight: ...No, you were just so helpful that I couldn't resist@laughing.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, jeez...@You got a real weird sense a' humor...
'Ey, if I was helpful, then I ain't a thing like your@mother...!
I mean, she had you bustin' your chops@all the time...

group_1.textRight: ...Does it bother you that I said you reminded me@of her?

group_1.textLeft: Well, kinda...

group_1.textRight: ...Sorry, but you really are alike.

group_1.textLeft: That so, huh... Guess you ain't becomin'@my apprentice after all...

group_1.textRight: ...Nah, that's not necessarily true.

group_1.textLeft: Seriously?!

group_1.textRight: (Thinking about my foolish mother,)
(I wanted nothing more than to die to make@amends... That still lives on in my heart.)
(Now a woman saying the same things my mother@did has appeared right in front of me...)
(Trying to hammer those words into me again...)
(This time, I have the chance to accept them.)
(What I should do is...not reject them, but rather...)

group_1.textLeft: Th-then, millionth time's the charm!
I want ya to be my apprentice!

group_1.textRight: ...[wait:0.8][chara:104000:motion_100][chara:104000:lipSynch_1]Yes ma'am.

group_1.narration: [textRed:I will live with her, devote myself to her,]@[textRed:and continue to make amends...]
And thus I took the hand that Teacher offered me,@and decided to live as a Coordinator.
I am sure that she does not know the@full reason why I became her apprentice.
There is much I do not know about her, either.
I don't even know@where our relationship will take us.
However, I can say one thing for certain:
This memory is definitely@an incredibly important beginning for me.
